scenarioDescription:
The K2-127 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-127 is a star with 0.72 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.66 times its radius. It is located 2315.70 light years away from the solar system.

K2-127 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-127 system


K2-127 b

K2-127 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-127 b is 53.106 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-127 b is 8.370 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-127 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-127, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-127 - System With 1 Exoplanet
